abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Northern Restructuring
            Project for Russian Federation were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: both the
            federal and local restructuring components provided support
            to develop or amend federal and municipal reforms in housing
            and utility services management as an integral part of
            increased management capacity of the federal and municipal
            level. The comprehensive approach to voluntary out-migration
            was essential in the effective demonstration of the
            cost-effective interventions supported by the project. The
            out-migration supported included essential elements such as
            voluntary outmigration, choice of recipient location, local
            restructuring plans, comprehensive information, and public
            relations campaigns. Projects' design should build
            flexibility to adjust on the basis of experience during
            implementation; project legal documentation should reflect
            this flexibility and implementation particularities should
            be included in the operational manual. Selection of a
            limited number of participating municipalities and using a
            pilot as the vehicle was the right instrument to test
            measures to support and expand outmigration.

TF037579-RUSSIA - NORTH MIGRATION,TF037580-RUSSIA - MIGRATION PILOT,TF037759-RUSSIA - NORTH MIGRATION,TF039516-RUSSIAN FEDERATION - NORTHERN

repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Northern Restructuring
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Northern Restructuring Project for
            the Russian Federation aims to test a set of actions that
            will allow participating municipalities in the Russia North
            to realize the benefits of economic restructuring and
            facilitate the implementation of sustainable municipal
            policies; and thereby to assist the Government in developing
            a national strategy for restructuring the economy of the
            northern areas. The major changes include: (i) the expansion
            of the migration scheme supported by the project to new
            participating localities; (ii) an increase in the amount of
            the migration assistance allowance; and (iii) an increase in
            Government co-financing for the project. The changes will
            enable the project to meet fully the current project
            development objective, to ensure broader dissemination of
            project results, and to mainstream project results in
            national policies.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Northern Restructuring Project for
            the Russian Federation aims to test a set of actions that
            will allow participating municipalities in the Russia North
            to realize the benefits of economic restructuring and
            facilitate the implementation of sustainable municipal
            policies; and thereby to assist the Government in developing
            a national strategy for restructuring the economy of the
            northern areas. These actions include: 1) voluntary
            out-migration assistance schemes for people whose economic
            prospects are limited; and 2) measures that will allow
            municipalities to realize potential economic benefits
            resulting from a decreased population. Beside a project
            management component, there are four main components: 1) The
            Migration Assistance Component facilitates the out-migration
            of specific groups of population in the participating
            regions. Allowances are given for housing and transport of
            household belongings and plane/train tickets. 2) The Local
            Restructuring Support Component provides technical
            assistance to help participating municipalities to reduce
            their dilapidated and unused housing stock, and implements
            reforms in housing and utility services management. 3) The
            Monitoring and Evaluation Component monitors the process,
            and evaluates the economic outcomes of restructuring, social
            aspects of out-migration, and the evaluation and
            dissemination of project outcomes. 4) The Federal Component
            helps introduce regulatory procedures aimed at gradually
            deregulating the Northern economy.
